**Goal:** Perform EDA Part 1 â€” explore movie dataset through genre frequency, rating distribution, and identify trends or outliers to guide deeper analysis.



```{r setup, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse); library(data.table); library(tidyr); library(GGally)
merged <- fread("data/merged_data_final.csv")
```

```{r}
cat("Total unique movies:", n_distinct(merged$movieId), "\n")
if ("userId" %in% names(merged)) cat("Total unique users:", n_distinct(merged$userId), "\n")

```

### Genre bar chart

```{r fig.width=7, fig.height=5}
merged %>%
  separate_rows(genres, sep=" +") %>%
  filter(genres != "") %>%
  count(genres, sort=TRUE) %>%
  slice_head(n=20) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=reorder(genres, n), y=n)) + geom_col() + coord_flip() +
  labs(title="Top Genres", x="Genre", y="Count")
```


### Ratings hist (if ratings present via avg_rating)

```{r}
if ("avg_rating" %in% names(merged)) {
  merged %>% ggplot(aes(avg_rating)) + geom_histogram(bins=30) +
    labs(title="Avg Rating per Movie", x="Avg Rating", y="Count")
}
```

```{r}
if (all(c("avg_rating", "rating_count") %in% names(merged))) {
merged %>%
select(avg_rating, rating_count) %>%
GGally::ggpairs(title = "Pairwise Relationship: Avg Rating vs Rating Count")
}

```

```{r}
if ("rating_count" %in% names(merged)) {
ggplot(merged, aes(y=rating_count)) +
geom_boxplot(fill="orange", outlier.color="red", outlier.shape=8) +
labs(title="Boxplot: Rating Count (Outlier Check)", y="Rating Count")
}

```
